intro: Alyxia manusiana, commonly known as the Malayan alyxia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually small, clustered in umbels, and exhibit a range of colors from white to pink. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
